Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery krater; glazed on the interior; outside, probably Dionysos, seated to left, his head turned to right and inclined, holding a thyrsus in his right hand; preserved are his shoulder and upper body, part of his face, upraised right arm, and stem of thyrsus.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 104 no. 366 pl. 78)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1158)
